item.title: Colt Telecom attack claimed by WarLock ransomware, data up for sale
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: UK-based telecommunications company Colt Technology Services is dealing with a cyberattack that has caused a multi-day outage of some of the company's operations, including hosting and porting services, Colt Online and Voice API platforms. [...]

item.title: Cisco warns of max severity flaw in Firewall Management Center
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cisco is warning about a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the RADIUS subsystem of its Secure Firewall Management Center (FMC) software. [...]

item.title: Microsoft reminds of Windows 10 support ending in two months
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has reminded customers that Windows 10 will be retired in two months after all editions of Windows 10, version 22H2 reach their end of servicing on October 14. [...]

item.title: Plex warns users to patch security vulnerability immediately
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Plex has notified some of its users on Thursday to urgently update their media servers due to a recently patched security vulnerability. [...]

item.title: US sanctions Grinex crypto-exchange, successor to Garantex
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of the Treasury has announced sanctions against Grinex, the successor to Russian cryptocurrency exchange Garantex, which was previously sanctioned for helping ransomware gangs launder their money. [...]

item.title: Over $300 million in cybercrime crypto seized in anti-fraud effort
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: More than $300 million worth of cryptocurrency linked to cybercrime and fraud schemes has been frozen due to two separate initiatives involving law enforcement and private companies. [...]

item.title: Crypto24 ransomware hits large orgs with custom EDR evasion tool
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Crypto24 ransomware group has been using custom utilities to evade security solutions on breached networks, exfiltrate data, and encrypt files. [...]

item.title: Pro-Russian hackers blamed for water dam sabotage in Norway
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Norwegian Police Security Service (PST) says that pro-Russian hackers took control of critical operation systems at a dam and opened outflow valves. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows Server bug causing cluster, VM issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has resolved a known issue that triggers Cluster service and VM restart issues after installing July's Windows Server 2019 security updates. [...]

item.title: Booking.com phishing campaign uses sneaky 'ん' character to trick you
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Threat actors are leveraging a Unicode character to make phishing links appear like legitimate Booking.com links in a new campaign distributing malware. The attack makes use of the Japanese hiragana character, ん, which can, on some systems, appear as a forward slash and make a phishing URL appear realistic to a person at first. [...]

item.title: When Theft Replaces Encryption: Blue Report 2025 on Ransomware & Infostealers
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Picus Security
item.description: Ransomware and infostealers are winning on stealth, not encryption. Picus Blue Report 2025 reveals just 3% of data exfiltration attempts are stopped. Find and fix your biggest exposure gaps before they're exploited. [...]

item.title: Canada’s House of Commons investigating data breach after cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The House of Commons of Canada is currently investigating a data breach after a threat actor reportedly stole employee information in a cyberattack on Friday. [...]
